item.title: 约翰迪尔上调年度利润预期，因农业条件改善
item.description: 约翰迪尔公司上调了全年盈利预期，这家全球最大的农业机械制造商预计农业经济将很快好转。【原文：Deere & Co. boosted its profit outlook for the year as the world’s largest farm-machinery maker anticipates the agriculture economy will get better soon.】

item.title: "买美国"仍是全球投资者的首选交易策略
item.description:
去年，海外投资者增持了美国股票和债券。

【原文：

Overseas investors purchased an increased amount of US stocks and bonds last year.

】

item.title: 德国央行称年末工资增长加速
item.description: 德国联邦银行表示，2025年末德国工资增长有所加快，但近期达成的协议表明未来薪资涨幅将有所收窄。【原文：German wage growth quickened at the end of 2025, though recent agreements point to smaller salary increases ahead, according to the Bundesbank.】

item.title: 通胀担忧令美国国债遭遇一个月来最差表现
item.description: 美国国债正面临一个月来最长的连跌行情，因美伊紧张局势升级加剧了市场对石油驱动通胀的担忧。【原文：Treasuries are on course for their longest losing streak in a month as growing tensions between the US and Iran fuel oil-driven inflation fears.】

item.title: 高盛称自2007年以来多数大盘股选股者跑赢大盘
item.description: 高盛集团策略师指出，随着股市涨势从科技巨头向更广泛领域扩散，今年迄今跑赢基准的大盘股主动型共同基金比例已创2007年以来新高。【原文：The proportion of large-cap active mutual funds outperforming their benchmark so far this year is the highest since 2007 as equity market gains broaden beyond big tech, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.】

item.title: 卢旺达逆势而行，实施三年内最大幅度的加息
item.description: 卢旺达央行实施近三年来最大幅度的加息，旨在抑制短期通胀，此举与非洲大陆普遍的宽松趋势背道而驰。【原文：Rwanda’s central bank delivered its largest interest-rate increase in almost three years in an effort to curb inflation in the near term, bucking a broader easing trend across Africa.】

item.title: 人工智能的扩张野心使公用事业领域成为竞争激烈的增长板块
item.description: 精明的投资者多年来一直正确押注，认为人工智能应用的电力需求将为电力公司带来财富。如今，这一押注突然突破主流认知，直冲云霄。【原文：Savvy investors have been betting, correctly, for years now that electricity demand for AI applications will deliver riches to power companies. All of a sudden, that wager’s blasted past the mainstream and into the stratosphere.】

item.title: 树莓派首席执行官厄普顿在股价飙升94%后欣然接受"迷因股"标签
item.description: 埃本·厄普顿周一在加利福尼亚滑雪度假时，注意到自己公司的股价正在攀升。【原文：Eben Upton was on a ski holiday in California on Monday when he noticed shares in his company were ticking up.】

item.title: 米莱的劳工改革考验着阿根廷的工业心脏
item.description:
哈维尔·米莱承诺，他的劳工改革将使就业机会重返阿根廷。但该国的工业城市正准备迎接新一轮的困境。【原文：

Javier Milei promete que su reforma laboral traerá los empleos de regreso a Argentina. Pero sus ciudades industriales se preparan para otra ronda de sufrimiento.

】

item.title: 米莱的劳工改革遭遇钢铁小镇困境的现实
item.description:
哈维尔·米莱承诺，他推动的劳动法改革将为阿根廷创造就业机会。但该国的工厂城镇正为新一轮的痛苦做准备。【原文：

Javier Milei promises his overhaul of labor laws will bring jobs back to Argentina. But its factory towns are bracing for another round of pain.

】

item.title: CVC正与高盛合作推进10亿欧元码头业务出售事宜
item.description: 知情人士透露，CVC资本合伙公司正与高盛集团合作，探讨出售地中海游艇码头运营商D-Marin的事宜。【原文：CVC Capital Partners PLC is working with Goldman Sachs Group Inc. to explore a sale of Mediterranean marina operator D-Marin, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 贾里德·斯利珀论哪些软件公司能挺过SaaS末日浩劫
item.description:
软件行业实际的运作方式。

【原文：

How the software business actually works.

】

item.title: 零散股：如何在SaaS末日生存（播客）
item.description: 今年开局对软件公司而言堪称惨烈。 业界普遍担忧人工智能与先进编程模型的崛起将彻底颠覆这个行业。但即便在人工智能引发恐慌之前，软件公司的增长势头已然放缓。那么这个行业究竟如何运作？更重要的是，哪些类型的公司能真正挺过这场"SaaS末日"（或者说"SaaS灾难"）？本期节目中，我们采访了资深软件投资人贾里德·斯利珀。【原文：The start of the year has been an absolutely brutal one for software companies. There’s a big fear that the rise of AI and advanced coding models will pull the rug out from this industry. But even before these AI fears, software companies were seeing their growth slow. So how does the business actually work? And more importantly, what types of companies will actually survive the “SaaSpocalypse”? (Or maybe “the CaSaaStrophe”?) On this episode, we speak with Jared Sleeper, a longtime software inve】

item.title: 阿尔特曼与阿莫代：人工智能对手拒绝在莫迪峰会上握手言和
item.description: 昔日对手，永世为敌。【原文：Once a rival, always a rival.】

item.title: 津巴布韦央行行长敦促贷款机构降低收费
item.description: 在此注册订阅每周两次的《Next Africa》通讯，并通过Apple、Spotify或您常用的平台订阅《Next Africa》播客。【原文：Sign up here for the twice-weekly Next Africa newsletter, and subscribe to the Next Africa podcast on Apple, Spotify or anywhere you listen.】

item.title: 日本股市迎来自2014年以来最大规模外资流入
item.description: 在首相高市早苗赢得历史性选举胜利后的几天里，外国投资者买入了十多年来最多的日本股票和期货。【原文：Foreign investors bought the most Japanese stocks and futures in more than a decade in the days following Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s historic election win.】

item.title: 法国削减赤字计划前景不明朗，审计机构称
item.description: 法国审计法院表示，即使政府将预算赤字削减目标调低至低于最初计划的水平，该国今年实现赤字削减的战略仍"存在很大不确定性"。【原文：France’s strategy to reduce its budget deficit this year remains “very uncertain,” even after the government set less ambitious targets than initially planned, the country’s audit court said.】

item.title: 莫迪在新德里峰会上力推印度成为经济实惠的人工智能枢纽
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉·莫迪将印度定位为经济实惠且可扩展的人工智能枢纽，称这个南亚国家研发的创新成果可推广至全球。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi presented India as a hub for affordable and scalable artificial intelligence, saying innovations developed in the South Asian nation could be deployed globally.】

item.title: 施罗德买入英国国债，押注英央行政策转向，将投资重心转向十年期债券
item.description: 施罗德集团正增持英国国债并转向长期债券，押注英国央行降息将引发英国国债价格上涨。【原文：Schroders Plc is buying UK government bonds and shifting into longer-dated debt, a bet that Bank of England interest-rate cuts will spark a rally in gilts.】

item.title: 英国初创企业转向人工智能而非高成本新员工招聘
item.description: 英国创业活动似乎正蓬勃发展，数以万计的新企业如雨后春笋般涌现。但对劳动者而言，问题在于这些初创企业越来越多地采用人工智能和自由职业者，而非雇佣正式员工。【原文：British entrepreneurship appears to be on the rise, with tens of thousands of new businesses popping up. The problem, for workers, is that these startups are increasingly using artificial intelligence and freelancers instead of taking on permanent staff.】

item.title: 瑞士手表出口再度下滑，美国市场复苏未能持久
item.description: 瑞士手表出口在经历了上月因美国关税松动而短暂回升后，今年1月再度陷入长期低迷。【原文：Swiss watch exports resumed their long slump in January after a brief respite the previous month triggered by the easing of US tariffs.】

item.title: 随着奢华旅行的复苏，酒店运营商迎来溢价提升
item.description: 随着酒店业从疫情低谷中复苏，豪华旅行需求的增长正为酒店经营者带来收益。【原文：Hotel operators are benefiting from a boost in demand for luxury travel, as the industry rebounds from pandemic lows.】

item.title: 软件风暴令Atlassian创始人财富蒸发72亿美元
item.description: 迈克尔·坎农-布鲁克斯在三十多岁时就成为亿万富翁，并凭借软件即服务公司Atlassian Corp.十多年前的首次公开募股，跻身澳大利亚最富有的科技高管之列。【原文：Michael Cannon-Brookes became a billionaire in his 30s and one of Australia’s richest tech executives with the initial public offering of software-as-a-service firm Atlassian Corp. just over a decade ago.】

item.title: 印尼央行维持利率不变，货币压力持续存在
item.description: 印度尼西亚央行维持基准利率不变，在政策制定者权衡增长与稳定风险之际，采取审慎立场应对印尼盾因近期市场动荡持续承压的局面。【原文：Bank Indonesia kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged, maintaining a cautious stance as the rupiah continues to reel from recent market turbulence while policymakers weigh growth and stability risks.】

item.title: 外国投资者因人工智能担忧重启抛售印度IT股
item.description: 人工智能对软件行业构成的日益严峻的威胁，促使外国投资者削减对印度信息技术股票的投资。【原文：The growing threat posed by artificial intelligence to the software industry has led foreign investors to cut exposure to Indian information technology stocks.】

item.title: 陆逊梯卡继承人推出140亿欧元计划解决遗产纠纷
item.description: 据《共和国报》报道，依视路集团创始人莱昂纳多·德尔·韦基奥的其中一位儿子正考虑以140亿欧元（约合165亿美元）的价格，从其两位兄弟手中收购家族控股公司额外25%的股份，此举有望化解这场旷日持久的继承权僵局。【原文：One of EssilorLuxottica SA founder Leonardo Del Vecchio’s sons is considering buying an additional 25% of the family holding company from two of his siblings, in a €14 billion ($16.5 billion) deal that would help resolve a protracted inheritance stalemate, Repubblica reported.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织敦促南非制定财政规则以遏制债务增长
item.description: 国际货币基金组织表示，南非即将出台的预算案必须实现债务目标，以维护公众对公共财政的信心，而采用财政锚将提供关键支持。【原文：South Africa’s upcoming budget must deliver on debt targets to preserve confidence in public finances and adopting a fiscal anchor would provide key assistance, said the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 泰克公司季度盈利大幅跃升，铜价飙升助推业绩增长
item.description: 泰克资源公司——这家正被英美资源集团收购的加拿大矿业公司——报告称，得益于铜价上涨，其盈利大幅攀升，同时重申了包括奎布拉达布兰卡矿在内的产量指导目标。【原文：Teck Resources Ltd. — the Canadian miner being acquired by Anglo American Plc — reported a jump in earnings aided by higher copper prices, while reaffirming output guidance including at the Quebrada Blanca mine.】

item.title: 印度国有银行吸纳外资，逆市逆流而上
item.description: 印度国有银行逆势而上，在外国投资者普遍撤离该国股市之际，凭借更优估值和更强劲的增长前景吸引资金流入。【原文：India’s state-run banks are bucking a broader foreign pullback from the country’s equities, drawing inflows as lenders offer better valuations and stronger growth prospects.】

item.title: 富时100指数有望延续涨势，英镑汇率趋稳
